content: ***a free pattern from kelbourne woolens as part of the greater philly yarn crawl check out all three shawls here 1 *** **worthy of note** this simple and fun crochet shawl is worked back and forth from the top down you can follow the written or charted instructions the two yarns are worked held together for the body of the shawl on a larger hook and then the border is worked solely in the harmony silk mohair blend depending on your gauge you may be able to work more or fewer repeats of the pattern be sure to stop with enough yarn to work the double_crochet edging before the border **specifications yarn** kelbourne woolens silk blend no 1 50% wool 30% silk 20% cotton 202 yds/50 gms dark gray 1 skein kelbourne woolens harmony 72% kid mohair 28% mulberry silk 230 yds /25 gms 443 sage blue 1 skein **gauge** 3 double_crochet ch1 clusters and 4 double_crochet row = 4 10 cm on larger hook after blocking **hook** 1 us i/9 5 5mm hook 1 us g/6 4mm hook **notions** tapestry needle **size** 19 5 49 5 cm depth and 38 96 5 cm at widest point **skills** double_crochet chain and half_double_crochet stitches crochet from charts optional 1 https //www ravelry com/patterns/sources/kelbourne-woolens-three-shawls/patterns
